text: private “Frutiger” fonts hosted AWS “cynkraweb” S3 bucket. browsers (e.g. Firefox) block font access “CORS” headers set correctly. allow access, domain needs whitelisted within CORS configuration block S3 bucket. addition, ACL settings bucket must set “public read” files can actually accessed first place.

what: cynkra blog, dm and similar repositories
title: pkgdown template for cynkra packages
text: cynkra blog, cynkratemplate, dm similar repositories use fonts cynkra/cynkraweb GitHub, specifically font-family: "frutiger", sans-serif; font weights 300 (light), 400 (normal), 700 (bold). Please ensure use 500, 600, bolder, weights, browser render using faux styles. Keep mind since Cynkra blog loads fonts absolute URLs (e.g. src: url("https://cynkra.com/assets/fonts/frutiger-400.woff2") format("woff2");), font update cynkra/cynkraweb GitHub repository, URLs might change, requiring updates end well.

title: pkgdown template for cynkra packages
text: see Frutiger fonts within local previews, need allow CORS localhost files. setting usually browsers hence block resources different origin. fonts served via AWS S3, origin differs localhost. Chromium-based browsers, “CORS Unblock” extension job. similar extensions Firefox browsers. Safari less strict CORS serve Frutiger font default.
